Body.Content:
In Microsoft Purview | Insider Risk Management, we are rolling out a new Reports page.

Insider Risk Management correlates various signals to identify potential malicious or inadvertent insider risks, such as IP theft, data leakage, and security violations. Insider

Risk Management enables customers to create policies based on their own internal policies, governance, and organizational requirements. Built with privacy by design, users are pseudonymized by default, and role-based access controls and audit logs are in place to help ensure user-level privacy.

This message is associated with Microsoft 365 Roadmap ID 169889.

When this will happen:

Public Preview began rolling out November 2023.

Standard Release: We will begin rolling out late January 2024 and expect to complete by late February 2024. 

How this will affect your organization:

In Insider Risk Management, the three charts currently available on the Alerts page--total alerts that need review, average time to resolve alerts, and alerts summary--are moving to the new Reports page.

What you need to do to prepare:

No action is needed to prepare for this change. You may want to notify your admins about this change and update any relevant documentation as appropriate.

You can access Insider Risk Management in the Microsoft Purview compliance portal.

Learn more: Investigate insider risk management activities | Microsoft Learn

Title: Microsoft Purview | Insider Risk Management: New Reports page
